name: sql-crack
description: Visualize SQL queries with interactive flow diagrams

sqlCrack.defaultDialect.description: Default SQL dialect for parsing queries

sqlCrack.syncEditorToFlow.description: Highlight flow nodes when clicking in SQL editor

enumDescriptions: Opens beside the SQL file (like Markdown preview)
Opens as a new tab in the editor area
sqlCrack.viewLocation.description: Where to display the SQL visualization panel

sqlCrack.autoRefresh.description: Automatically refresh visualization when SQL file changes (with debounce)

sqlCrack.autoRefreshDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds before auto-refresh triggers (default: 500ms)

sqlCrack.workspaceAutoIndexThreshold.description: Maximum number of SQL files to auto-index on workspace analysis (larger workspaces require manual confirmation)

enumDescriptions: File-level dependency graph. Nodes are SQL files; edges show which files reference tables defined in other files.
Table-level dependency graph. Nodes are tables/views; edges show references (SELECT, JOIN, INSERT, etc.).
Files plus prominent tables (referenced 3+ times). Mix of file and table nodes.
sqlCrack.workspaceGraphDefaultMode.description: Default mode for the Workspace Dependencies Graph tab. Used when the panel loads or when you refresh the index.

sqlCrack.advanced.cacheTTLHours.description: Cache time-to-live in hours. Set to 0 to disable caching. Index will be rebuilt after this time. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.clearCacheOnStartup.description: Always rebuild index when VS Code opens the workspace. Overrides cache TTL. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.defaultTheme.description: Default theme for SQL Crack visualizations. 'auto' matches VS Code theme, 'dark' or 'light' forces a specific theme. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.showDeadColumnHints.markdownDescription: Show hints for columns selected but not used in WHERE/ORDER BY/GROUP BY/HAVING/JOIN clauses. Disable if you get too many false positives (columns used by application layer). (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.combineDdlStatements.markdownDescription: Combine consecutive DDL statements (CREATE TABLE, CREATE VIEW, etc.) into a single visualization block. Useful for schema files with many DDL statements. Shows count of tables/views created. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.customAggregateFunctions.description: Additional aggregate function names to recognize (e.g., ["MY_CUSTOM_AGG", "COMPANY_SUM"]). These are added to the built-in dialect functions.

sqlCrack.customWindowFunctions.description: Additional window function names to recognize (e.g., ["MY_CUSTOM_RANK"]). These are added to the built-in dialect functions.

sqlCrack.additionalFileExtensions.markdownDescription: Additional file extensions to treat as SQL files (e.g., `[".tpt", ".dbsql", ".hql", ".bteq"]`). Extensions should include the leading dot. These files will show the SQL Crack icon in the editor title bar and can be visualized.
